seo.title: Nano Banana Pro AI Generator - Logic-Driven Art & Text | z-image.app
seo.description: Try Nano Banana Pro, the reasoning-based image generator. Create perfectly spelled text, consistent characters, and viral 3D figurine art. The next evolution of AI.

structuredData.name: Nano Banana Pro
structuredData.description: A reasoning-based AI image generator capable of understanding physical logic, rendering perfect text, and maintaining character consistency.

hero.title: Nano Banana Pro: The AI That Understands Logic
hero.tagline: It doesn't just match pixels; it simulates the scene. Experience the viral sensation capable of perfect text rendering, physical accuracy, and uncannily realistic 3D textures.

imageGallery.title: Nano Banana Pro Showcase: Logic & Detail
imageGallery.description: Witness the power of reasoning-based generation. Explore a collection featuring the viral '3D figurine' aesthetic, perfectly spelled typography, and scenes with flawless physical logic.

images.alt: Blueprint Style Technical Drawing of a Futuristic Coffee Machine

how_to.title: How to Use Nano Banana Pro
how_to.description: Harness the reasoning engine in three simple steps. No complex engineering required.

steps.title: 1. Select the Model
steps.description: Navigate to the model selector dropdown in the top-left corner of the dashboard. Scroll through the list and click 'Nano Banana Pro' to activate the reasoning engine.

media.alt: Close up of the model selector dropdown showing Nano Banana Pro being selected.

steps.title: 2. Prompt & Reference
steps.description: Type your prompt describing the scene's logic. You can also upload reference images to guide style or character identity. Nano Banana excels at understanding complex relationships between objects.

media.alt: User interface showing a prompt input and an uploaded reference image of a character.

steps.title: 3. Generate & Refine
steps.description: Click 'Generate' and wait for the reasoning core to simulate the scene. Once complete, you can use conversational editing to tweak details (e.g., 'make the text blue') without regeneration.

media.alt: A generated result showing a perfectly spelled neon sign in a realistic street scene.

useCases.title: Impossible Realism Made Easy
useCases.description: Nano Banana Pro solves the hardest problems in AI art: hands, text, and physical logic.

scenarios.description: Marketing teams use Nano Banana Pro to generate ready-to-use advertising posters. Unlike older models, it renders complex slogans and brand names with perfect spelling and typographic hierarchy directly into the image.

image.alt: A coffee shop storefront with a sign that clearly reads 'Morning Brew' generated by AI.

scenarios.tagline: Turn any character into a physical toy.
scenarios.description: Capitalizing on the viral trend, concept artists use the model to visualize characters as high-fidelity, hand-painted plastic figurines. The model simulates subsurface scattering and studio lighting to create tangible-looking collectibles.

image.alt: A macro shot of a toy soldier figurine with realistic plastic textures and paint wear.

scenarios.tagline: Keep the same face across every shot.
scenarios.description: Authors and storyboarders rely on Nano Banana's 'identity lock' feature. By uploading a single reference face, they can generate the same character in different emotions, angles, and lighting conditions without face distortion.

image.alt: Three panels showing the same woman in a spacesuit from different angles.

scenarios.description: Interior designers use the model to visualize complex room layouts. Nano Banana understands that a reflection in a mirror must match the object, and that shadows must fall correctly based on the window position, saving hours of manual correction.

image.alt: A modern living room with technically accurate mirror reflections and shadow casting.

features.title: The 'Reasoning' Advantage
features.description: Built on a new architecture that plans the image before painting it. Here is what sets Nano Banana Pro apart.

items.title: Scene Reasoning Engine
items.description: Nano Banana doesn't just halluncinate pixels. It understands object relationships (e.g., 'a cat *on* a mat'), ensuring that objects don't clip into each other and gravity is respected.

items.title: Native Text Capability
items.description: Generate logos, comic bubbles, and neon signs with near-100% spelling accuracy. It treats text as a distinct logical entity, not just texture.

items.title: Identity Preservation
items.description: Using advanced reference injection, the model can 'memorize' a character's face or an object's design and replicate it perfectly across new prompts.

items.title: Anatomical Precision
items.description: The logic core understands the skeletal structure of humans, significantly reducing the 'extra fingers' or 'impossible limbs' issues common in older diffusion models.

items.title: Conversational Editing
items.description: Don't like the color? Just tell it. Nano Banana allows for multi-turn edits (e.g., 'Now make it raining') that modify the scene while keeping the composition intact.

items.title: Hyper-Real Texture
items.description: Famous for its 'Figurine' and 'Macro' modes, the model renders materials like plastic, skin pores, and fabric weaves with microscopic detail.

items.question: Is Nano Banana Pro only for Anime?
items.answer: No. While it became viral for its '3D Anime Figurine' style, Nano Banana Pro is a general-purpose reasoning model capable of photorealism, architectural visualization, and graphic design.

items.question: Why is it called 'Nano Banana'?
items.answer: It originated as an internal codename for the 'small but potent' version of a larger reasoning model (rumored to be related to Gemini 3). The community embraced the name during its anonymous testing phase.

items.question: How does 'Reasoning' make it different from Stable Diffusion?
items.answer: Traditional diffusion models guess what pixels look good together. Nano Banana Pro first constructs a logical 'plan' of the scene (where objects sit, how light falls) and then renders it, resulting in fewer physical errors.

items.question: Can I really generate text with it?
items.answer: Yes. You can specify exact text in quotes within your prompt (e.g., a sign saying 'Open 24/7'), and it will render legible, correctly spelled text most of the time.

items.question: Does it cost more credits than other models?
items.answer: Due to the intense compute required for the reasoning process, Nano Banana Pro costs 2x credits compared to our standard 'Lightning' models. However, the success rate is much higher, saving you retries.

items.question: Can I use reference images?
items.answer: Absolutely. The model supports 'Image-to-Image' and 'Style Transfer.' You can upload a sketch or a photo to guide the structure or character look of your generation.

items.question: Is there a limit to the text length?
items.answer: It excels at short to medium phrases (logos, headlines, street signs). Generating entire paragraphs of text may still result in some minor artifacts.

items.question: What is the best prompt style for this model?
items.answer: Unlike older models that needed 'word salad' (e.g., 'masterpiece, best quality, 8k'), Nano Banana Pro prefers natural language. Talk to it like a human: 'A photo of a red car parked on a rainy street, cinematic lighting.'

cta.title: Experience the Future of Logic-Based AI
cta.description: Stop wrestling with bad anatomy and gibberish text. Switch to Nano Banana Pro and generate images that actually make sense.
